text: The first thing I did when I started at Berkman, twenty years ago, was to get a blogging server up and running. It was 2003, so I used "Manila", a product we made at UserLand. It was the first weblog server at any university, in the world. Early days. A few years after I left they converted to WordPress. A solid move both times because by then UserLand had shut down and the default blogging server was the software made by my friend Matt.
